intro: Allium aybukeae, commonly known as Aybuke's garlic, is a rare species of flowering plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its bulbous structure and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its leaves are grass-like and narrow, while its flowers bloom in late spring or early summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
